div.p: VPRS 4363/PO/15, inward correspondence unregistered, no. 373, VA 912 Trustees of the Public Library, Museum and National Gallery of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Let me express my best thanks, dear Sir George, for the kind manner, in which you show your interest in the suggestion ventured by me, to secure the Heuzenroederian numismatic collection.
See M to G. Verdon, 20 February 1885. Perhaps at your next visit to Adelaide, you may have an opportunity to inspect it personally. This much I can say, that it exceeds very many times your coin-collection in the Library-Museum. Duplicates would, allow me to remark, become available for interchanges.
